channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked culvert, 11th September
item.description:
The water is not draining into the Brook. Last time this happened it flooded our garage and next door resulting in a big insurance claim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colwell Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Flooding footpath after / during rain preventing access, 11th September
item.description:
At the end of Jasmin way there is a footpath which connects to farmfield road. Each year when it rains the footpath floods and prevents access. This is a main walkway for children walking to school, mums with prams etc. when the water eventually drains away it leaves thick mud. New drainage / soak away needed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Stancombe Grove, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Follow up work required ?, 11th September
item.description:
Web Reference: 7884069 | Enquiry Number: 22082475 (this relates to my pothole report, the one at the top of the hill). .... Hello, there are TWO recently repaired potholes on Hucclecote Lane, one going south (to Hucclecote), just before the crest of the hill / lane, one going north to Churchdown. BOTH of them have a high 'lip' on the leading edge of the patches, that create quite a jolt when driving over them. Is there any way a team can go back and grind down the leading edge and make it smoother please ? Many thanks in advance !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road repair dangerous, 11th September
item.description:
The road (From Hucclecote to Churchdown) was repaired due to subsidence however the repair undertaken has left a significant bump in the road canvass which resultants in cars and bike driving unstable and people could loose control
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30 MPH Repeater sign is very faded, overgrown vegetation and leaning, 11th September
item.description:
///awoken.arena.unpainted A resident has complained that the 30 MPH Repeater sign on New Road is very faded, in particular is not picked up by headlights when driving at night. It has also got some overgrown vegetation and leaning slightly. There is a VAS sign coming towards Southam from Woodmancote warning drivers of the 30 MPH speed limit, but this is the only speed sign on New Road coming from Southam through to Woodmancote/Bishop's Cleeve so the resident has noticed continous speeding along New Road. It would be appreciated if the existing sign could be replaced with a new 30 MPH sign to remind drivers of the speed limit on New Road, in particular as it can't be seen after dark. Also bearing in mind the volume of traffic now using this road due to the A435 road closure. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: School Crossing Patrol Signal almost completely obscured by overgrown vegetation, 11th September
item.description:
///urgent.name.expose As you approach Bishop's Cleeve from Woodmancote coming over the bridge the School Crossing Patrol sign is almost completely obscured by overgrown vegetation and the flashing lights are not visible at all. The sign is clear as you look at it but on approach it's almost invisible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Two Hedges Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
